sub_topic: Finding the vertex cover of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
     1 - 2
    /     \
   3       4
  / \     / \
 5   6   7   8
```

Find the minimum vertex cover of the given graph.
message_2:
A vertex cover is a set of vertices such that each edge of the graph is incident to at least one vertex in the set. A minimum vertex cover is a vertex cover with the smallest possible number of vertices.

For the given graph, one possible minimum vertex cover is {2, 3, 4}. This set of vertices covers all the edges in the graph:

- Edge 1-2 is covered by vertex 2
- Edge 2-4 is covered by vertex 2 and vertex 4
- Edge 1-3 is covered by vertex 3
- Edge 3-5 is covered by vertex 3
- Edge 3-6 is covered by vertex 3
- Edge 4-7 is covered by vertex 4
- Edge 4-8 is covered by vertex 4

No smaller set of vertices can cover all the edges, so {2, 3, 4} is a minimum vertex cover for the given graph.
